importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the most recent public awareness of Doug Martin's death and the ongoing investigation into the circumstances surrounding his arrest and death.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame from early Saturday (October 6, 2025) to the publication of the article on October 20, 2025, captures the period of Martin's arrest, hospitalization, and subsequent death, highlighting the urgency and sensitivity of the event.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back, died at age 36 following a police arrest during a break-in investigation in Oakland, California.
Martin was involved in a break-in and reportedly had a brief struggle with police while being taken into custody.
His former agent, Brian Murphy, revealed that Martin privately struggled with mental health issues that significantly impacted his life and contributed to his actions that day.
Martin was taken into custody after fleeing his home in Stockton, California, and entering a neighbor's home, where authorities found him disoriented and overwhelmed.
The Oakland Police Department, Mayor Barbara Lee, and various oversight bodies including the city police commission and county district attorney's office are investigating the incident.
Martin was selected as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers history and had a distinguished career including Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors.
An autopsy has been scheduled to determine the cause of death, which has not yet been released.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, best known for his career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at age 36 after being taken into custody by Oakland police during an investigation into a break-in. According to his former agent, Martin had long struggled with mental health issues and became disoriented and overwhelmed, fleeing his home in Stockton and entering a neighbor’s house. A brief struggle occurred during the arrest, and he later died in hospital after being transported by paramedics. The Oakland Police Department, Mayor Barbara Lee, and various oversight agencies are investigating the incident. An autopsy is scheduled to determine the cause of death, which has not been released. Martin, a first-round draft pick in 2012, was recognized as one of the top players in Buccaneers history.
title: Former NFL Star Doug Martin Dies After Police Arrest in Oakland
